newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigeria has 28,000 ghost workers on payroll.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria has 28,000 ghost workers on payroll.

text.p: An audit task force appointed by the Nigerian government said on Friday it had discovered 28,000 "ghost workers" on the bloated payroll of the state.

The figure represented the discrepancy in the official staff list and the actual number of staff the task force found in the public service, the chairman of the audit panel Fortunatus Williams said while submitting the report to the authorities.

Williams said the report confirmed the widely-held view about "ghost workers" who are either fake, retired or dead persons whose names remain on the payroll for fraudulent officials to claim their wages.
"The phenomenon of ghost workers is real and therefore the institutional mechanism for dealing with it needs to be improved upon," he said.
Last month the military government ordered that salaries of public servants should be from now on be paid to each worker physically so as to fish out non-existent workers.
Williams said as at last August, the state employed a total of 510,065, consisting of 156,075 in government ministries and 353,990 in state agencies and companies.
